snippet.textDisplay: Wii games on Wii U are still 480p. The image is indeed upscaled to 1080p, but not the game's resolution. Playing Wii games on Wii U through HDMI is sharper than playing on Wii with component cables and letting the TV upscale it, but that's it.
snippet.textOriginal: Wii games on Wii U are still 480p. The image is indeed upscaled to 1080p, but not the game's resolution. Playing Wii games on Wii U through HDMI is sharper than playing on Wii with component cables and letting the TV upscale it, but that's it.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not being silly m8 ... The Wiiu VC version is upscaled to even 1080 p ... Granted the native resolution is indeed 480p but there is still a significant difference
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not being silly m8 ... The Wiiu VC version is upscaled to even 1080 p ... Granted the native resolution is indeed 480p but there is still a significant difference

snippet.textDisplay:
Why are you even doing this? I know you're being cute, but in case you aren't.

Wii is 480p maximum and not native widescreen. That means the pixels are still 640x480, however the TV can stretch the image so the game appears to be widescreen, since the game renders more on screen. The video is still only 4:3 though.

Now stop being silly.
snippet.textOriginal:
Why are you even doing this? I know you're being cute, but in case you aren't.

Wii is 480p maximum and not native widescreen. That means the pixels are still 640x480, however the TV can stretch the image so the game appears to be widescreen, since the game renders more on screen. The video is still only 4:3 though.

Now stop being silly.

snippet.textDisplay: Other M was a fun game .... But it felt like a letdown in comparison to the legend thats the Prime Trilogy ... The story was full of plotholes and don't forget our old friend Adam and his permission to use the Varia Suit and other items ... The character of Samus was degraded from bad ass bountyhunter to a emo ... So that was a big mistake ... That said however : I really enjoyed the gameplay and thought it was still a really fun game in that regard
snippet.textOriginal: Other M was a fun game .... But it felt like a letdown in comparison to the legend thats the Prime Trilogy ... The story was full of plotholes and don't forget our old friend Adam and his permission to use the Varia Suit and other items ... The character of Samus was degraded from bad ass bountyhunter to a emo ... So that was a big mistake ... That said however : I really enjoyed the gameplay and thought it was still a really fun game in that regard

snippet.textDisplay:
Well, you clearly have no idea what Metroid is about. Other M strips away everything that made Metroid what is was (Full of isolation, desperation, and most importantly..MYSTERY). TN turned Samus from an intriguing badass, to a melo-dramatic emo child..."Uhhh, you don't get me..". And you can't say the game play makes up for that, because it doesn't.

The old adage applies here, less is more.
snippet.textOriginal:
Well, you clearly have no idea what Metroid is about. Other M strips away everything that made Metroid what is was (Full of isolation, desperation, and most importantly..MYSTERY). TN turned Samus from an intriguing badass, to a melo-dramatic emo child..."Uhhh, you don't get me..". And you can't say the game play makes up for that, because it doesn't.

The old adage applies here, less is more.

snippet.textDisplay: Echoes was a decent game, but followup games never are better than the originals, at least where Nintendo is concerned. Ocarina > Majora, Waker, Twilight, Skyward. Original Prime > Echoes. Not to say that all of these games are not very nice in their own respects, it is simply that the originals will always be the best.
snippet.textOriginal: Echoes was a decent game, but followup games never are better than the originals, at least where Nintendo is concerned. Ocarina > Majora, Waker, Twilight, Skyward. Original Prime > Echoes. Not to say that all of these games are not very nice in their own respects, it is simply that the originals will always be the best.

So, you're basically saying that the 2nd best game of the generation isn't very good. Sure, that might be your own opinion, but since almost everyone else agrees it's not a very good example of a 'bad game'. 

Skyward Sword is more of a love/hate because of its very unique controls. Majority of people love the controls, and most people think that it's the best controls for a game that they've ever played.

I guess you haven't played MK7 and SM3DL since you used the wrong names for them.

snippet.textDisplay: Just incase you aren't, Super Mario Galaxy is possibly one of the best games of the generation, in fact, it's recieved the 2nd highest reviews (metacritic average) of the generation. Skyward Sword is absolutely fantastic, the majority believe that it's the best Zelda game yet. Super Mario 3D Land isn't as amazing as galaxy, but it sure is fun, also recieving great reviews. And Mario Kart 7 is also great fun, though the Mario Kart formula stays almost identical unlike other Nintendo franchises.

snippet.textDisplay: This game had a certain feel to it that NO other game has ever had. Total immersion. It wasn't a few corridors and maybe an open room, it was a planet. It was inhabited, it had colour, it had life.  The music fit the overall tone of the areas, being ominous without being dark and depressing. Did Gears of War have this same quality? Heck no. Halo? Please. The Prime series is, well... prime.
snippet.textOriginal: This game had a certain feel to it that NO other game has ever had. Total immersion. It wasn't a few corridors and maybe an open room, it was a planet. It was inhabited, it had colour, it had life.  The music fit the overall tone of the areas, being ominous without being dark and depressing. Did Gears of War have this same quality? Heck no. Halo? Please. The Prime series is, well... prime.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky i bought MP trilogy at best buy about 6 months ago for the normal price. they had lots in stock at my towns best buy, even at a point where all the reviews i watched before i made the purchase said that it was impossible to find anymore. maybe thats cause not many in my town like wii so they had extra. or maybe im just lucky. xD but yea its totally worth whatever price. i love it so much. ive beaten mp1, and am still beating mp2 and 3.

snippet.textDisplay: At first, I hated Metroid Prime due to the controls. Luckily the Metroid Prime Trilogy fixed that for me.
snippet.textOriginal: At first, I hated Metroid Prime due to the controls. Luckily the Metroid Prime Trilogy fixed that for me.

snippet.textDisplay: Hearing this tune for the first time blew my mind. Metroid prime was a dream come true. I am a huge fan of super metroid and this title made the 8 year wait well worth it. I just wish I had the Original NTSC version in the trilogy, the PAL version ruined the chozo lore for me. Some company unaffiliated with nintendo re-wrote all the lore to sound better but it sucks compared to the original imho.
snippet.textOriginal: Hearing this tune for the first time blew my mind. Metroid prime was a dream come true. I am a huge fan of super metroid and this title made the 8 year wait well worth it. I just wish I had the Original NTSC version in the trilogy, the PAL version ruined the chozo lore for me. Some company unaffiliated with nintendo re-wrote all the lore to sound better but it sucks compared to the original imho.

snippet.textDisplay: Didnt his track change half way through the game? either way, it was still one of the best games ever. it will probably be in my top 10 games for a while to come, man i love gaming.

snippet.textDisplay: The planet of Tallon IV will always be the most memorable location in Metroid history, comparing even to the likes of Zebes. Metroid Prime, arguably the greatest Metroid period. Super Metroid being the only comparable game in the series.
snippet.textOriginal: The planet of Tallon IV will always be the most memorable location in Metroid history, comparing even to the likes of Zebes. Metroid Prime, arguably the greatest Metroid period. Super Metroid being the only comparable game in the series.

I own all 3 games but I don't regret, that I bought the Trillogy :D

I think a game like this deserves such a high price^^

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky I love MP1, played through 3/4ths of MP2 but got stuck and kind of forgot about it (not as good as MP1 I must admit). Never played MP3, cause I don't own a Wii (although I'd like too), and if I did own I Wii I probably would of gotten the MP Trilogy, heheh. 

But on the point of the music, yeah I have always thought that MP1's music was extremely well done and memorable. I loved the use of electronic sounds along with somewhat organic sounds.
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky I love MP1, played through 3/4ths of MP2 but got stuck and kind of forgot about it (not as good as MP1 I must admit). Never played MP3, cause I don't own a Wii (although I'd like too), and if I did own I Wii I probably would of gotten the MP Trilogy, heheh. 

But on the point of the music, yeah I have always thought that MP1's music was extremely well done and memorable. I loved the use of electronic sounds along with somewhat organic sounds.

snippet.textDisplay:
I thought this game had the most memorable songs in the trilogy when it comes to overworld themes, with music like this one, Phendrana (both versions), the Chozo Ruins, the Lava caves, etc.

I really regret not buying the MP trilogy on the Wii when it came out, now I can't find it at a normal price.
